item.title: Curating the Autumn Collection
item.description:
As the leaves turn golden and the air grows crisp, we are thrilled to unveil our Autumn Collection. This season, we are focusing on warmth, texture, and history.

Expect to see rich mahogany furniture, brass accents, and textiles that invite you to curl up with a good book. We’ve scoured estate sales and hidden corners of the countryside to find pieces that tell a story.

One of our favorite finds is a set of Victorian library chairs, upholstered in a deep, hunter green velvet. They are the perfect place to sit and watch the rain fall against the windowpane. We believe that your home should be a sanctuary, and this collection is designed to help you create just that.

item.title: The Art of Restoring Vintage Frames
item.description:
There is a certain magic in taking an old, tarnished frame and breathing new life into it. The process is slow, deliberate, and deeply rewarding.

In our latest project, we tackled a 19th-century gilded frame that had seen better days. The gold leaf was flaking, and the underlying gesso was cracked. It arrived at our shop covered in decades of dust, a shadow of its former glory.

We started by carefully cleaning the surface, using gentle solvents to remove the grime without damaging the delicate gilding that remained. It’s a process that requires patience; a rush job here could ruin the piece forever. Once clean, we stabilized the flaking areas, injecting a conservation-grade adhesive behind the gold leaf.
